Articles.Content:
No... Constellation. The feels! It really was a cool program.

SLS is pretty much Constellation, except with more realistic goals.
Can someone give me the skinny for doing science on an asteroid? I saw a lot of captures during the marathon, but I didn't see anyone doing science.
AFAIK it's surface samples only, but you can get different samples from the same asteroid depending on what SoI/orbital height it's at.

SLS is pretty much Constellation, except with more realistic goals.

Still though, going to mars and return! In only 8-9 Launches! Manned! I understand SLS is much more realistic, but you just can't beat what that programme proposed, it was all just so awesome! Still gonna try it mostly stock with the new update anyway.
Is this update already out or is it coming out very soon? Am not really sure.

Is this update already out or is it coming out very soon? Am not really sure.

Unfortunately, it has not been released yet. Do you think we would be here discussing it if the masses could get their hands on it?

Is this update already out or is it coming out very soon? Am not really sure.

Oh believe me, you'll definitely know when the update comes out

My speculation is a Monday or Tuesday release, to give Squad time to finish fixing bugs and whatnot. Regardless if I am correct, the update is definitely close!

But ... but ... Age of Wonders 3 is released on Monday.

Why must Squad ALWAYS release their new versions of KSp when other games I'm hyped for come out?

I think I'm going to get to work on a ring system around Kerbin. Shouldn't be too hard if the asteroid population is high enough... Keep launching fuel tanks, dock them to stations built on the asteroids, and then keep docking the asteroids together, or at least placing them in close orbits... no gravity between them... holy hell, i think, just maybe, this might make things really, really interesting.

But ... but ... Age of Wonders 3 is released on Monday.

Why must Squad ALWAYS release their new versions of KSp when other games I'm hyped for come out?

/offtopic: It looks a lot like Civ.

/ontopic: Who cares about anything, or any plans. KSP Is superior. KSP you must play.

/offtopic: It looks a lot like Civ.

/ontopic: Who cares about anything, or any plans. KSP Is superior. KSP you must play.

Ill play.... once the pack is out D':
I'm betting on Tuesday.
If i remember correctly, asteroids are slightly more dense then Kerbin water, but with low density parts attached they could float. (I think this was in Scott Manley's Dev. interview)

While I wait, I looked in my rocket cooking list. I threw a gemini, a sls, and an apollo and mashed it all up. This is what I got

...kinda slsey?

About what? spoilers actually working?

No, really, when did they come back?.

Apparently they've been here for a while. And don't make a new thread, there is one already.
I like those boosters; they look like the Advanced Boosters for later Blocks of the SLS.

Apparently they've been here for a while. And don't make a new thread, there is one already.

That 'a while' is about a week long. Credits go to KasperVld.

That 'a while' is about a week long. Credits go to KasperVld.

Oh. My bad, I just thought it was longer.

Back on topic, I will probably be doing a heavily modded let's play/playthrough when .23.5 arrives.
First, I'll rework/upgrade all my heavy rockets, and remove the word 'heavy' from old ones. : )
I consider bigger parts an opportunity to do away with "heavy" and "super-heavy" and break into the territory of ultra- and uber-heavy lifters.

as the other question is answered.

No they only spawn near Kerbin's orbit.

If you're leaving Kerbin, you're in the zone where asteroids can spawn. If you're on the way to another planet from Kerbin, you're leaving Kerbin. Put those two statements together and it's pretty reasonable to say that if you're leaving Kerbin for another planet, you could encounter an asteroid.

Of course, if the OP meant "If I'm near another planet other than Kerbin, will I encounter an asteroid?" then the answer is no...unless you put it there.
I'm going to start by redesigning my KPCV to be stock.

My first goal will be to design new lifters to put in the subassemblies, based on payload weight supported. Last night I built test payloads with weights of 25, 50, 75, 100, 125, and 150 to test them with. I'll probably make a 200 ton test payload too. After that, we'll see.

Honestly? Starting over ... I am envious somehow ... every player starting out with a working/finished career mode now/later on ...

Found this vid today and it somes it up so well:

That's a great short

Lots of people have done so already, you could check out some of the archive videos from ksptv (on twitch).

Gods, I am sooooo far behind the times.
